isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - BAROMETRIC PRESSURE (BARO) SENSOR - BAROMETRIC PRESSURE SENSOR (BARO) OPERATION

svcproc.title: BAROMETRIC PRESSURE SENSOR (BARO) OPERATION
svcproc.para:
Refer to appropriate circuit diagram ( Figure 3.21 or 3.22
) for vehicles equipped with dual drive cabs) for the following description.

The ECM sends a regulated 5 volt signal from ECM (black) chassis connector terminal 3 to BARO connector terminal 2. The BARO sensor returns a variable voltage signal (represents atmospheric pressure) from BARO connector terminal 3 to the ECM at terminal 29. The BARO sensor is grounded from the BARO connector terminal 1 to the ECM signal ground terminal 11.
